title.narrative: Capacity building of beekeepers and expanding the international network

description.narrative:
Advice: Go for execution (October 2010):
The proposal has been adjusted for three months only and should be seen as a getting started project. With this small project Agriterra and SPUSK can get used to each other and well acquainted with each others' working style and things like financial management. The project includes an exchange visit to Slovenia, travel budget for coaching to member associations and purchase of communication equipment for SPUSK and members associations (computers) in order to better communicate and provide trainings to the members.
An advisory mission by the Dutch beekeepers association will support SPUSK in defining its longer term objcetives, activities and cooperation with Agriterrra/IFAD and the dutch beekeepers association. This misison will take place in November 2011.
.
This concept note focusses on the capacity building of the association as well as the capacity building (technical skills) of the individual members.
SPUSK proposes to organise an advanced training course on modern technology beekeeping for 50-60 professional beekeepers with international trainers.
A basic training course is proposed for 30-40 starting beekeepers, mostly young people. This course will be organised by SPUSK and they will themselves arrange the trainers.
A third training will be arranged on royal jelly and queen bees for the more advanced beekeepers. These products can add a good additional income for beekeepers.
The training programmes will be further elaborated by SPUSK and shared with Agriterra, including detailed costs as well as the planning.
It is important that SPUSK is expanding its international relations in order to be fully updated about the EU standards, as it is expected that very soon the EU will allow Bosnian beekeeping products in the EU. An international training on EU standards is therefore part of the proposal.
In order to strengthen the functioning of this young association, it is proposed to provide laptops to the 8 municipal associations being member of SPUSK. This will enhance the work, linkages, exchange of experiences etc.
In order to strengthen the functioning as an association, it is important to frequently visit all municipal organisations organize round tables and lectures and pay field visits to the individual beekeepers to provide technical coaching. A modest budget for monitoring visits, organising meetings and extension programmes is part of this proposal.
working towards a more professional organisation that can advocate on behalf of its members and improve its service provision to its members.
